analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dge ba'i chos de dag kyang gang zhe na /

analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun no //

analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos de dag spang ba la brtson pa yin no //

analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos de dag kyang gang zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug go /

original: de la 'dod chags rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /

analyzed: chen po dang / 'bring po dang / chung du'o //

original: de la 'dod chags chen po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags chen po gang zhe na /

analyzed: de la gzhol ba de la ngo tsha ba dang / 'dzem pa thams cad du thams cad med par 'gyur te /
translated: In one who is devoted to it, all shame and scruples are absent.

original: ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar na /

analyzed: ngo tsha ba dang / 'dzem pa thams cad du thams cad med pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: de gcig pu lkog tu song ste / de nyid rjes su rnam par sems /
translated: He goes off by himself and🔽thinks about it,

analyzed: de nyid rjes su rnam par rtog cing / de nyid legs @36a *//

analyzed: par shin tu smon pa dang / de nyid la'ang yon tan du lta ba yin te /
translated: He sees it as a good quality.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: In this way

original: de la ngo tsha ba med pa yin no //🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: de la ngo tsha ba med pa yin no // ji ltar na /
translated: he has no shame.

original: 'dzem pa med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dzem pa med pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: de'i rgyu / de'i rkyen de'i gzhis pha ma'am /

analyzed: bla ma lta bu gzhan dag dang rtsod cing phyir zlog pa dang / rgol par byed cing des ngo mi tsha la yon tan du lta ba yin te /
translated: and opposes them. He does not feel embarrassed by this, but sees it as a good quality.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: In this way

original: de la ngo tsha ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: de la ngo tsha ba med pa yin te /
translated: he has no embarrassment.

original: de de'i rgyu; de'i rkyen /
analyzed: de de'i rgyu; de'i rkyen /
translated: This is the cause,

original: de'i gzhis ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i gzhis ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: the condition, and the basis for his being born in the lower realms.

original: de ni / 'dod chags chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / 'dod chags chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‘great desire.’

original: de la 'dod chags 'bring po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags 'bring po gang zhe na /

analyzed: gang gis 'dod chags rnams la sten par gyur na bya ba grub kyi bar du sten gyi /
translated: When one is attached to sensual pleasures, one continues to enjoy them until one’s work is done.

analyzed: 'dod chags 'bring po zhes bya'o //

translated: What is lesser attachment?

original: mthong ba tsam gyis tshim par 'gyur ba de ni /
analyzed: mthong ba tsam gyis tshim par 'gyur ba de ni /
translated: When one is attached to sensual pleasures, one is satisfied with just seeing them, or with just touching them with one’s body, or with just smelling them, or with just tasting them, or with just hearing them, or with just thinking about them.

original: 'dod chags chung du zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags chung du zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called lesser attachment.

original: mdor na 'tsho ba'i yo byad thams cad la chags pa'i sems su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: mdor na 'tsho ba'i yo byad thams cad la chags pa'i sems su gyur pa ste /
translated: In brief, attachment is a state of mind that is attached to all the necessities of life.

original: de ni / 'dod chags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / 'dod chags zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called attachment.

original: de la zhe sdang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zhe sdang gang zhe na /
translated: What is aversion?

original: zhe sdang yang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang yang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: Hatred should be understood as threefold:

original: chen po dang / 'bring po dang / chung du'o //
analyzed: chen po dang / 'bring po dang / chung du'o //
translated: great, middling, and small.

original: de la zhe sdang @36b chen po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zhe sdang @36b chen po gang zhe na /
translated: What is great hatred?

original: zhe sdang gi rnam pa gang gis zhe sdang zhing rnga ma 'khrugs gtum par gyur nas mtshams med pa lnga las gang yang rung ba la la byed pa'am /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi rnam pa gang gis zhe sdang zhing rnga ma 'khrugs gtum par gyur nas mtshams med pa lnga las gang yang rung ba la la byed pa'am /
translated: Through the force of hatred, one becomes angry and hostile, and commits one of the five actions of immediate retribution.

original: dam pa'i chos spong ba gang byas pa la mtshams med pa lnga bsdoms kyang grangs su'ang nye bar mi 'gro /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos spong ba gang byas pa la mtshams med pa lnga bsdoms kyang grangs su'ang nye bar mi 'gro /
translated: Even if the five actions of immediate retribution were added together, they would not equal the evil of abandoning the true teaching.

original: cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro ba de lta bu byed do //
analyzed: cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro ba de lta bu byed do //
translated: They do not approach it even as an approximation, as a fraction, as an example, or as a cause.

original: de de'i rgyu /
analyzed: de de'i rgyu /
translated: That is the cause,

original: de'i rkyen / de'i gzhis lus zhig nas sems can dmyal ba chen po dag tu skye zhing /
analyzed: de'i rkyen / de'i gzhis lus zhig nas sems can dmyal ba chen po dag tu skye zhing /
translated: that is the condition, that is the basis for, after the break-up of the body, taking rebirth in the great hells.

original: gal te brgya lam na mir skye na'ang nag cing mig dmar la gtum zhing gnod sems mang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te brgya lam na mir skye na'ang nag cing mig dmar la gtum zhing gnod sems mang bar 'gyur te /
translated: If, by some chance, one is born as a human being, one will be dark-skinned, with red eyes, violent, and full of malice.

original: de de'i rgyu /
analyzed: de de'i rgyu /
translated: That is the cause,

original: de'i rkyen / de'i gzhis yang sems can dmyal ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba de ni /
analyzed: de'i rkyen / de'i gzhis yang sems can dmyal ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba de ni /
translated: Because of that, on account of that, they are reborn in the hells.

original: zhe sdang chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‘great hatred.’

original: de la zhe sdang 'bring po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zhe sdang 'bring po gang zhe na /
translated: “What is ‘medium hatred’?

original: gang gis zhe sdang bar gyur te sdig pa mi dge ba'i las byas na myur ba myur ba /
analyzed: gang gis zhe sdang bar gyur te sdig pa mi dge ba'i las byas na myur ba myur ba /
translated: If one becomes angry and commits evil, unwholesome actions, one quickly,

original: skyen pa skyen pa; la gor la gor du 'gyod cing de'i gnyen po la'ang sten pa ste /
analyzed: skyen pa skyen pa; la gor la gor du 'gyod cing de'i gnyen po la'ang sten pa ste /
translated: swiftly, and immediately regrets it and relies on its antidote.

original: de ni / zhe sdang 'bring po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / zhe sdang 'bring po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‘medium hatred.’

original: de la zhe sdang chung du gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zhe sdang chung du gang zhe na /
translated: “What is ‘small hatred’?

original: gang gis zhe sdang bar gyur nas tshig tsam dang / mi snyan pa tsam dang / ngan du brjod pa tsam gyis mi dge ba'i las gsog pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis zhe sdang bar gyur nas tshig tsam dang / mi snyan pa tsam dang / ngan du brjod pa tsam gyis mi dge ba'i las gsog pa ste /
translated: If one becomes angry and accumulates unwholesome actions merely through words, unpleasantness, or bad speech,

original: de'ang de la brgyal bar 'ga' 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'ang de la brgyal bar 'ga' 'byung ste /
translated: and if one faints,

original: byung na'ang de'i skad cig /
analyzed: byung na'ang de'i skad cig /
translated: then as soon as it happens,

original: yud tsam / de'i thang gcig la gnyen po la sten pa ste; de ni /
analyzed: yud tsam / de'i thang gcig la gnyen po la sten pa ste; de ni /
translated: in that very moment, one relies on its antidote.

original: zhe sdang chung du zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang chung du zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‘small hatred.’

original: de la gti mug gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gti mug gang zhe na /
translated: What is delusion?

original: gti mug kyang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gti mug kyang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: Delusion should be understood as threefold:

original: chen po dang / 'bring po dang / chung du'o //
analyzed: chen po dang / 'bring po dang / chung du'o //
translated: great, middling, and small.

original: gang de la gti mug chen po gang @37a *//
analyzed: gang de la gti mug chen po gang @37a *//
translated: What is great delusion?

original: zhe na / gang ji skad du smos pa'i gnas de dag la nyes kyang dga' zhing mya ngan du mi byed /
analyzed: zhe na / gang ji skad du smos pa'i gnas de dag la nyes kyang dga' zhing mya ngan du mi byed /
translated: It is the delight in and the non-remorse for the faults mentioned above,

original: smre sngags mi 'don /
analyzed: smre sngags mi 'don /
translated: the non-lamentation,

original: 'gyod pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gyod pa med pa yin te /
translated: and the non-repentance.

original: de ni / gti mug chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / gti mug chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called great delusion.

original: de la gti mug 'bring po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gti mug 'bring po gang zhe na /
translated: What is middling delusion?

original: gang gis mi dge ba'i las la la byas kyang la gor la gor du 'gyod cing /
analyzed: gang gis mi dge ba'i las la la byas kyang la gor la gor du 'gyod cing /
translated: It is the remorse for some unwholesome actions,

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi drung du 'chags shing mi 'chab la /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi drung du 'chags shing mi 'chab la /
translated: the confession in the presence of spiritual friends, and the non-concealment.

original: de yon tan du'ang mi lta ba yin te /
analyzed: de yon tan du'ang mi lta ba yin te /
translated: But it is not the view of virtues.

original: 'di ni / gti mug 'bring po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / gti mug 'bring po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called middling delusion.

original: de la gti mug chung du gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gti mug chung du gang zhe na /
translated: What is small delusion?

original: gang gis rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: gang gis rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba ma yin pa /
translated: It is the non-remorse for the natural faults,

original: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba bslab pa kun spyad pa'i lam gnyis gsum las 'da' ba ste /
analyzed: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba bslab pa kun spyad pa'i lam gnyis gsum las 'da' ba ste /
translated: The second is to transgress the rules of training that are prohibitions.

original: de ni / gti mug chung du zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / gti mug chung du zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “lesser delusion.”

original: de la'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems phyir zlog pa la mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: de la'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems phyir zlog pa la mkhas pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva is skilled in turning back the mind from that.

original: de de ltar sems la mkhas pa la /
analyzed: de de ltar sems la mkhas pa la /
translated: When he is skilled in the mind in that way,🔽he does not delight in desires, does not aspire to desires, and is not attached to desires.

original: gang 'dod pa rnams la dga' ba dang / 'dod pa rnams la mos pa dang / 'dod pa rnams la lhag par chags pa de lta bu med pa yin te; de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang 'dod pa rnams la dga' ba dang / 'dod pa rnams la mos pa dang / 'dod pa rnams la lhag par chags pa de lta bu med pa yin te; de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ltar sems la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar sems la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is skilled in the mind in that way.

original: 'on te lung du ma bstan pa la spyod na /🔽de la dran pa dang ldan zhing nan tan du byed la /
analyzed: 'on te lung du ma bstan pa la spyod na / de la dran pa dang ldan zhing nan tan du byed la /
translated: “If he is practicing a neutral action,🔽he is mindful and makes an effort.

original: de brtag pa la brtson pa yin te /
analyzed: de brtag pa la brtson pa yin te /
translated: He is diligent in investigating it.

original: de la ji ltar na lung du ma bstan pa la spyod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na lung du ma bstan pa la spyod pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is he practicing a neutral action?

original: gang gi tshe sems phyi rol tu'ang mi rgyu /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems phyi rol tu'ang mi rgyu /
translated: When the mind does not move externally

original: nang du'ang mi rgyu /
analyzed: nang du'ang mi rgyu /
translated: or internally,

original: dge ba la'ang mi spyod /
analyzed: dge ba la'ang mi spyod /
translated: and he is not practicing virtue,

original: mi dge ba la'ang mi spyod /
analyzed: mi dge ba la'ang mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage in nonvirtue.

original: lhag @37b mthong ba'ang mi spyod /
analyzed: lhag @37b mthong ba'ang mi spyod /
translated: They do not engage in vipaśyanā.

original: zhi gnas kyang mi 'dzin cing zhum la gnyid kyis non par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyang mi 'dzin cing zhum la gnyid kyis non par gnas pa ste /
translated: They do not maintain śamatha. They are discouraged and overcome by sleep.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / skyes bu nyal nyal ba las sad pa mig gnyid kyis bsgribs pa'i sems mi gsal ba de bzhin du de'i tshe sems la mi gsal bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu nyal nyal ba las sad pa mig gnyid kyis bsgribs pa'i sems mi gsal ba de bzhin du de'i tshe sems la mi gsal bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Just as a person who has woken up from sleep has a mind that is unclear due to the eyes being covered by sleep, in the same way, at that time, the mind becomes unclear.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems gzengs bstod pa dang / rab tu dga' bar bya ba dang / yang dag par gzhag pa la mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems gzengs bstod pa dang / rab tu dga' bar bya ba dang / yang dag par gzhag pa la mkhas pa yin te /
translated: In this regard, bodhisattvas are skilled in encouraging the mind, in delighting it, and in correctly settling it.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: In this way,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: bodhisattvas are skilled in the mind.

original: de de ltar sems la mkhas pa'i chos 'di dag ni /🔽sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: de de ltar sems la mkhas pa'i chos 'di dag ni / sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: “These phenomena, which are like that, are skilled in the mind.

original: chos 'di dag ni /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni /
translated: These phenomena are like an illusion.

original: rmi lam lta bu'o //🔽chos 'di dag ni /🔽dge ba'o // chos 'di dag ni /
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'o // chos 'di dag ni / dge ba'o // chos 'di dag ni /
translated: These phenomena are like a dream.🔽These phenomena are virtuous.

original: mi dge ba'o //🔽chos 'di dag ni /🔽'byung ba'o // chos 'di dag ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba'o // chos 'di dag ni / 'byung ba'o // chos 'di dag ni /
translated: These phenomena are nonvirtuous.🔽These phenomena are produced.

original: mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: These phenomena are unproduced.

original: zhes chos rnams la yongs su rtog ste /
analyzed: zhes chos rnams la yongs su rtog ste /
translated: Thus, they thoroughly investigate phenomena.

original: de 'di snyam du chos 'di dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du chos 'di dag thams cad ni /
translated: They think, ‘All these phenomena

original: sems la gnas pa /
analyzed: sems la gnas pa /
translated: are based on the mind,

original: sems las byung ba /
analyzed: sems las byung ba /
translated: arise from the mind,

original: sems sngon du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: sems sngon du 'gro ba ste /
translated: and are preceded by the mind.

original: sems shin tu bcil /
analyzed: sems shin tu bcil /
translated: If the mind is well restrained,

original: shin tu btul /
analyzed: shin tu btul /
translated: well subdued,

original: shin tu khong du chud par byas na /
analyzed: shin tu khong du chud par byas na /
translated: and well understood,

original: chos de dag thams cad kyang shin tu bcil ba dang / shin tu btul ba dang / shin tu khong du chud par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad kyang shin tu bcil ba dang / shin tu btul ba dang / shin tu khong du chud par 'gyur te /
translated: all these phenomena will also be well restrained, well subdued, and well understood.’

original: des chos rnams de ltar mthong bas /🔽de'i rgyu / de'i rkyen /
analyzed: des chos rnams de ltar mthong bas / de'i rgyu / de'i rkyen /
translated: Thus, they see phenomena in this way.

original: de'i gzhis sems zhi bar bya ba'i phyir nan tan byed de /
analyzed: de'i gzhis sems zhi bar bya ba'i phyir nan tan byed de /
translated: They apply themselves to pacifying the mind through its causes, conditions,🔽and bases.

original: de sems nyid la sems 'dogs so //
analyzed: de sems nyid la sems 'dogs so //
translated: They apply the mind to the mind.

original: sems nyid kyis sems zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: sems nyid kyis sems zhi bar byed do //
translated: The mind pacifies the mind.

original: sems nyid la sems rab tu bzhag go /🔽de de ltar zhi ba la @38a *//
analyzed: sems nyid la sems rab tu bzhag go / de de ltar zhi ba la @38a *//
translated: They settle the mind in the mind.

original: brtson pas sems rtse gcig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: brtson pas sems rtse gcig tu 'gyur te /
translated: Since they are thus diligent in pacifying, their minds become one-pointed.

original: rtse gcig tu red nas mnyam par gzhog go /
analyzed: rtse gcig tu red nas mnyam par gzhog go /
translated: Having become one-pointed, they rest in equipoise.

original: sems mnyam par bzhag pa la dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba mngon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems mnyam par bzhag pa la dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba mngon du 'gyur te /
translated: In the mind that is in equipoise, the joy that arises from isolation becomes manifest.

original: de yid dga' bar gyur nas 'dod pa las dben /
analyzed: de yid dga' bar gyur nas 'dod pa las dben /
translated: When the mind is joyful, it is isolated from desire.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa /🔽rtog pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa / rtog pa dang bcas pa /
translated: It is isolated from nonvirtuous phenomena.

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: It is endowed with investigation and analysis.🔽It is endowed with joy and pleasure that arise from isolation.

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: It is the first concentration.

original: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa mi snang bar bya ba'i phyir nan tan byed cing dga' ba dang / bde ba'i ro'ang myang bar mi byed de /
analyzed: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa mi snang bar bya ba'i phyir nan tan byed cing dga' ba dang / bde ba'i ro'ang myang bar mi byed de /
translated: In order to make investigation and analysis disappear, he practices with joy and does not experience the taste of pleasure.

original: mi rtag go snyam nas bsam gtan dang po las sems skyed do //
analyzed: mi rtag go snyam nas bsam gtan dang po las sems skyed do //
translated: Thinking that it is impermanent, he turns his mind away from the first concentration.🔽He is free from investigation and analysis and his mind is free from attachment.

original: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing chags pa med pa'i yid du gyur pas nang yongs su dang ste /
analyzed: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing chags pa med pa'i yid du gyur pas nang yongs su dang ste /
translated: His mind is completely pure internally.

original: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa /
translated: His mind is unified and free from investigation and analysis.🔽It is endowed with joy and pleasure that arise from isolation.

original: dpyod pa med pa /
analyzed: dpyod pa med pa /
translated: It is the second concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: He abides in the second concentration, which is born of samādhi, and is filled with joy and bliss.

original: de dga' ba dang sdug bsngal ba yin par khong du chud par byed de /🔽sdug bsngal lo snyam nas btang snyoms la gnas pa yin /🔽btang snyoms la gnas pas dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin can yin te /
analyzed: de dga' ba dang sdug bsngal ba yin par khong du chud par byed de / sdug bsngal lo snyam nas btang snyoms la gnas pa yin / btang snyoms la gnas pas dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin can yin te /
translated: He understands that joy is suffering.🔽He abides in equanimity,

original: bde ba lus kyis myong la /
analyzed: bde ba lus kyis myong la /
translated: and with mindfulness and introspection he experiences physical bliss.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa dang ldan pa bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o //
translated: The noble ones declare that he abides in equanimity, mindfulness, and bliss.

original: zhes brjod pa @38b de dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa @38b de dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: He abides in the third concentration, which is free of joy.

original: de bsam gtan gsum pa gtong ngo snyam nas bsam gtan bzhi pa la sems gtong ste /
analyzed: de bsam gtan gsum pa gtong ngo snyam nas bsam gtan bzhi pa la sems gtong ste /
translated: He thinks, “I will give up the third concentration,” and he directs his mind to the fourth concentration.

original: de bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pas bdag tu 'dzin pa phyir ldog go /
analyzed: de bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pas bdag tu 'dzin pa phyir ldog go /
translated: He attains the fourth concentration, and his grasping at self is reversed.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa phyir ldog pas bde ba'ang spong /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa phyir ldog pas bde ba'ang spong /
translated: His grasping at self being reversed, he gives up bliss.

original: sdug bsngal ba'ang spong ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'ang spong ste /
translated: They also abandon suffering.

original: de bde ba'ang spangs /
analyzed: de bde ba'ang spangs /
translated: They abandon pleasure.

original: snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba'ang nub pas bde ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba'ang nub pas bde ba'ang ma yin /
translated: They abandon suffering and previously abandon pleasure and, since mental pleasure and mental discomfort have subsided, they also abandon equanimity.

original: sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa btang snyoms dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa btang snyoms dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: They perfectly accomplish and dwell in the fourth concentration that is neither pleasure nor suffering, which is purified equanimity and mindfulness.

original: de bdag gi lus dang nam mkha'i lus su gcig tu mos par byed de /
analyzed: de bdag gi lus dang nam mkha'i lus su gcig tu mos par byed de /
translated: They imagine their own body and the body of space to be one.

original: de de ltar mos pas gzugs kyi 'du shes las thams cad du thams cad yang dag par 'das pa yin /
analyzed: de de ltar mos pas gzugs kyi 'du shes las thams cad du thams cad yang dag par 'das pa yin /
translated: Through such imagination, they completely transcend all perceptions of form.

original: thogs pa'i 'du shes kyang nub pa yin /
analyzed: thogs pa'i 'du shes kyang nub pa yin /
translated: The perception of obstruction subsides.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: They completely transcend all perceptions of form.

original: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: The notion of obstruction disappears, and since he does not pay attention to the notion of variety, he thinks, “Space is infinite,” and he abides having attained the sphere of infinite space.

original: de nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so //🔽de rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang @39a *//

analyzed: de'ang byang chub sems dpas yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: The bodhisattvas, with their correct wisdom, know this correctly and as it is.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba'i rgyun la mkhas pa yin no //🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba'i rgyun la mkhas pa yin no // ji ltar na /
translated: the bodhisattvas are skilled in the continuity of cyclic existence.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba ldog pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba ldog pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are the bodhisattvas skilled in the reversal of cyclic existence?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar dpyod de /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar dpyod de /
translated: Here the bodhisattvas analyze this as follows:

original: ma rig pa med par gyur pas 'du byed la zhen par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ma rig pa med par gyur pas 'du byed la zhen par mi 'gyur /
translated: “When ignorance ceases, formations will not be fixated upon.

original: 'du byed la zhen pa med par gyur pas rnam par shes par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'du byed la zhen pa med par gyur pas rnam par shes par mi 'gyur /
translated: Since there is no clinging to formations, consciousness does not come into being.

original: rnam par shes pa med par gyur pas ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med par gyur pas ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since consciousness does not come into being, name and form, the six sense spheres, contact, feeling, and craving do not come into being.

original: sred pa med par gyur pas len pa mi 'byung ste /🔽len pa med pas srid par yang mtshams sbyor ba med par 'gyur /
analyzed: sred pa med par gyur pas len pa mi 'byung ste / len pa med pas srid par yang mtshams sbyor ba med par 'gyur /
translated: Since craving does not come into being, grasping does not arise.🔽Since there is no grasping, there is no linking with existence.

original: srid par yang mtshams sbyor ba med par gyur pas /
analyzed: srid par yang mtshams sbyor ba med par gyur pas /
translated: Since there is no linking with existence,

original: skye bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: skye bar mi 'gyur /
translated: there is no birth.

original: skye ba med par gyur pas rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams rgyun chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba med par gyur pas rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams rgyun chad par 'gyur te /
translated: Since there is no birth, aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and strife are all extinguished.

original: de'ang byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: de'ang byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: Bodhisattvas know this with correct wisdom, just as it is.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: In this way,

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba ldog pa la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba ldog pa la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is skilled in reversing cyclic existence.

original: ji ltar na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la @42a *//
analyzed: ji ltar na / byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la @42a *//
translated: How is it that

original: mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: the bodhisattva is skilled in the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar dpyod de /🔽chos 'dis ni /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar dpyod de / chos 'dis ni /
translated: Here the bodhisattva analyzes as follows:

original: rgyun du zhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Through this Dharma, one becomes a stream enterer.

original: 'dis ni / lan gcig phyir 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni / lan gcig phyir 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Through this, one becomes a once-returner.

original: 'dis ni / lan gcig phyir mi 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni / lan gcig phyir mi 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Through this, one becomes a non-returner.

original: 'dis ni / dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa /
analyzed: 'dis ni / dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa /
translated: Through this, one becomes a worthy one whose defilements are exhausted,

original: srid pa kun tu sbyor ba chad pa'ang mtshams sbyor ba med pa /
analyzed: srid pa kun tu sbyor ba chad pa'ang mtshams sbyor ba med pa /
translated: who has severed the bonds of existence, who is free from fetters,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang dag par gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang dag par gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and who is inclined toward nirvāṇa.

original: chos 'dis ni /
analyzed: chos 'dis ni /
translated: Through this Dharma,

original: rang sangs rgyas bse ru lta bu gcig pu spyod par 'gyur ro snyam ste /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas bse ru lta bu gcig pu spyod par 'gyur ro snyam ste /
translated: one becomes a solitary buddha who practices alone like a rhinoceros.”

original: de thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis rab tu rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: de thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis rab tu rtogs par byed de /
translated: The bodhisattva fully understands all of this through correct wisdom.

original: chos 'di dag mngon du mi byed do //
analyzed: chos 'di dag mngon du mi byed do //
translated: I will not actualize these dharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks like this:

original: sems can gyi khams bdag gis bzung bdag gis sengge'i sgra bsgrags te sems can 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa na gnas pa thams cad sgrol lo //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams bdag gis bzung bdag gis sengge'i sgra bsgrags te sems can 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa na gnas pa thams cad sgrol lo //
translated: ‘I have taken on the realm of sentient beings. I have roared the lion’s roar, saying, “I will liberate all sentient beings dwelling in the wilderness of cyclic existence.”

original: zhes dam bcas la /
analyzed: zhes dam bcas la /
translated: I have made this promise.

original: gcig pu 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa nas 'byung ba ni; bdag gi mi che'o snyam ste /
analyzed: gcig pu 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa nas 'byung ba ni; bdag gi mi che'o snyam ste /
translated: It would not be right for me to leave the wilderness of cyclic existence alone.’

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: In this way,

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mkhas pa yin no //🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mkhas pa yin no // ji ltar na /
translated: the bodhisattva is skilled in the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po la mkhas pa yin zhe na /🔽'di la byang chub sems dpa' bslab pa thams cad la'ang slob la slob pa'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po la mkhas pa yin zhe na / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bslab pa thams cad la'ang slob la slob pa'ang mi dmigs /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattva’s skill in the Great Vehicle consist in?

original: bslab pa'i lam yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: bslab pa'i lam yang mi dmigs so //
translated: In this case, the bodhisattva trains in all the trainings, yet he does not observe any training, nor does he observe the path of training.

original: gang slob pa de'ang @42b mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gang slob pa de'ang @42b mi dmigs so //
translated: He does not observe the one who trains.

original: de'i rgyu / de'i rkyen /
analyzed: de'i rgyu / de'i rkyen /
translated: He does not observe the cause, the condition,

original: de'i gzhis chad par lta bar mi ltung ste /
analyzed: de'i gzhis chad par lta bar mi ltung ste /
translated: He does not fall into the extreme of nihilism.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po la mkhas pa yin no //🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po la mkhas pa yin no // ji ltar na /
translated: the bodhisattva is skilled in the Great Vehicle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bdud kyi las spong ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bdud kyi las spong ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the bodhisattva is skilled in abandoning the works of Mara?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' mi dge ba'i grogs po thams cad du thams cad yongs su spong ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' mi dge ba'i grogs po thams cad du thams cad yongs su spong ste /
translated: Here the bodhisattva completely abandons all unwholesome friends,

original: mi cha ba'i yul la gnas pa dang / 'jig rten rgyang phan pa'i gsang tshig la rten cing sgom pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / mchod pa dang / rim gro la ched cher 'dzin pa thams cad du thams cad yongs su spong ngo //
analyzed: mi cha ba'i yul la gnas pa dang / 'jig rten rgyang phan pa'i gsang tshig la rten cing sgom pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / mchod pa dang / rim gro la ched cher 'dzin pa thams cad du thams cad yongs su spong ngo //
translated: all dwelling in unsuitable places, all reliance on and cultivation of the spells of the materialists, and all valuing of gain, honor, offerings, and praise.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan gang byang chub kyi lam gyi bar chad du 'gyur ba de dag kyang thams cad du thams cad yongs su spong zhing de dag gi gnyen po la'ang sten to //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan gang byang chub kyi lam gyi bar chad du 'gyur ba de dag kyang thams cad du thams cad yongs su spong zhing de dag gi gnyen po la'ang sten to //
translated: He completely abandons all other subsidiary defilements that are obstacles to the path of enlightenment, and he cultivates their antidotes.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: byang chub sems dpa' bdud kyi las yongs su spang ba la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bdud kyi las yongs su spang ba la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is skilled in avoiding the works of Māra.

original: ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar na /
translated: How is it that

original: byang chub sems dpa' ma log pa'i shes rab can yin zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ma log pa'i shes rab can yin zhe na /
translated: the bodhisattva is not mistaken in his wisdom?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten pa'i gtsug lag dang / gsang tshig dang / bzo'i gnas thams cad la shes rab gtong ste /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten pa'i gtsug lag dang / gsang tshig dang / bzo'i gnas thams cad la shes rab gtong ste /
translated: Here the bodhisattva directs his wisdom to all the mundane sciences, incantations, and arts,

original: de'ang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'ang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: but only in order to bring all sentient beings to maturity.

original: shes kyi khe 'dod pa dang / grags pa 'dod pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti 'dod pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
analyzed: shes kyi khe 'dod pa dang / grags pa 'dod pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti 'dod pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: He does not do so out of desire for gain, fame, or honor, nor out of desire for the profit of knowledge.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa'i phyir te /🔽de la yon tan du blta ba'i phyir ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i che ba nyid brjod pa'i phyir te / de la yon tan du blta ba'i phyir ni /
translated: He does so in order to proclaim the greatness of the teaching of the Tathāgatas.

original: ma yin no //🔽gzhan du na de 'di @43a *//
analyzed: ma yin no // gzhan du na de 'di @43a *//
translated: He does not do so in order to see any good qualities in himself.

original: snyam du sems te /🔽gsung rab 'di ni /
analyzed: snyam du sems te / gsung rab 'di ni /
translated: Otherwise, he would think as follows:

original: dam pa ste /
analyzed: dam pa ste /
translated: “This scripture is excellent.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos 'dul ba'o snyam nas de de la yon tan du lta bas mu stegs can gzhan gyi lta ba can du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos 'dul ba'o snyam nas de de la yon tan du lta bas mu stegs can gzhan gyi lta ba can du mi 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, he thinks, “This is the Dharma and Vinaya of the Tathāgata,” and by viewing it as a good quality, he does not become one who has the view of other tīrthikas.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: In this way,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ma log pa'i shes rab can yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ma log pa'i shes rab can yin no //
translated: the bodhisattva is one who has unerring wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / ji ltar na /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' mnyam pa med pa'i shes rab can yin zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mnyam pa med pa'i shes rab can yin zhe na /
translated: how is it that the bodhisattvas are those who have unequaled wisdom?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten bdud dang bcas pa /🔽tshangs pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten bdud dang bcas pa / tshangs pa dang bcas pa /
translated: in this world with its gods, Māra, Brahmā,

original: skye rgu'i dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa /
analyzed: skye rgu'i dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa /
translated: śramaṇas, and brahmins,🔽with its people and gods, and with Māra and Brahmā,

original: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i nang na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma gtogs par gang de dang shes rab mnyam pa de lta bu'i sems can sems can gyi ris la med de /
analyzed: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i nang na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma gtogs par gang de dang shes rab mnyam pa de lta bu'i sems can sems can gyi ris la med de /
translated: there is no being in the realm of beings who is equal in wisdom to the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, except for the bodhisattvas.

original: de ni / 'jig rten lha dang bcas pa /
analyzed: de ni / 'jig rten lha dang bcas pa /
translated: This is the world with its gods,

original: bdud dang bcas pa /
analyzed: bdud dang bcas pa /
translated: with the māras,

original: tshangs pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: tshangs pa dang bcas pa /
translated: with Brahmā,

original: skye rgu'i dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa /
analyzed: skye rgu'i dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa /
translated: with the virtuous ascetics and brahmins,

analyzed: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i nang na shes rab kyi bye brag gis zil gyis mnan pa yin te /
translated: and with the gods, humans, and asuras, he is superior through the excellence of his insight.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: In this way,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mnyam pa med pa'i shes rab can yin no // rigs kyi bu; chos bcu po de dag dang ldan na /
translated: bodhisattvas are endowed with unequaled insight.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab phun sum tshogs pa rnams yin no //
translated: “Son of noble family, those who are endowed with these ten qualities are bodhisattvas who are endowed with perfect insight.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽chos bcu dang ldan na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / chos bcu dang ldan na /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' thabs @43b mkhas pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thabs @43b mkhas pa rnams yin no //
translated: those who are endowed with ten qualities are bodhisattvas who are skilled in means.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are those ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i thabs mkhas pa rnams yin /🔽mu stegs can rnam par zlog pa'i thabs mkhas pa rnams yin /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i thabs mkhas pa rnams yin / mu stegs can rnam par zlog pa'i thabs mkhas pa rnams yin /
translated: they are skilled in the means of dedication;🔽they are skilled in the means of turning away tīrthikas;

original: yul las rnam par zlog pa'i thabs mkhas pa rnams yin /
analyzed: yul las rnam par zlog pa'i thabs mkhas pa rnams yin /
translated: they are skilled in the means of turning away from objects;

analyzed: 'gyod pa yid la gcags pa sel ba'i thabs mkhas pa rnams yin / sems can la dpung gnyen byed pa'i thabs mkhas pa rnams yin /
translated: They are skilled in the means of dispelling regret and remorse.🔽They are skilled in the means of helping sentient beings.

original: sems can 'tsho ba'i thabs mkhas pa nye bar sbyor ba la mkhas pa rnams yin /
analyzed: sems can 'tsho ba'i thabs mkhas pa nye bar sbyor ba la mkhas pa rnams yin /
translated: They are skilled in the means of applying the livelihood of sentient beings.

original: len pa'i thabs mkhas pa rnams yin /
analyzed: len pa'i thabs mkhas pa rnams yin /
translated: They are skilled in the means of taking up.

original: gnas nas gnas su slong ba'i thabs mkhas pa rnams yin /
analyzed: gnas nas gnas su slong ba'i thabs mkhas pa rnams yin /
translated: They are skilled in the means of moving from place to place.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / gzengs bstod pa dang / shin tu dga' bar byed pa'i thabs mkhas pa rnams yin /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / gzengs bstod pa dang / shin tu dga' bar byed pa'i thabs mkhas pa rnams yin /
translated: They are skilled in the means of encouraging, inspiring, and bringing joy.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang rim gro bya ba'i thabs mkhas pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are skilled in the means of making offerings and serving the Tathāgatas.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽de la ji ltar na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / de la ji ltar na /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yongs su bsngo ba'i thabs mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: how are bodhisattvas skilled in dedication?

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽'di la byang chub sems dpa' gang 'di dag me tog gi rnam pa'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' gang 'di dag me tog gi rnam pa'am /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'bras bu'i rnam pa nga yir bya ba med pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rnam pa nga yir bya ba med pa /
translated: here bodhisattvas, with regard to whatever flowers or fruits they have that are not owned by anyone else,

analyzed: yongs su bzung ba med pa de rnams nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'bul lo //
translated: Three times a day and three times a night, they offer to the Buddhas and bodhisattvas all the trees that grow in the forest,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: and they dedicate this root of virtue to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de gang 'di dag bdug pa'i shing ngam /🔽spos kyi shing ngam /
analyzed: de gang 'di dag bdug pa'i shing ngam / spos kyi shing ngam /
translated: “They offer to the Buddhas and bodhisattvas all the trees that grow in the forest,🔽trees for incense,

original: rin po che'i shing ngam /🔽@44a *// dpag bsam gyi shing ngam /
analyzed: rin po che'i shing ngam / @44a *// dpag bsam gyi shing ngam /
translated: trees for perfume,🔽wish-granting trees,

original: me tog gi shing ngam /
analyzed: me tog gi shing ngam /
translated: flower trees,🔽and fruit trees, without any sense of ownership or possessiveness.

original: 'bras bu'i shing nga yir bya ba med pa yongs su bzung ba med pa de dag kyang nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'bul lo //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i shing nga yir bya ba med pa yongs su bzung ba med pa de dag kyang nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'bul lo //
translated: Three times a day and three times a night, they offer to the Buddhas and bodhisattvas all the trees that grow in the forest,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //

analyzed: bdag gis mtshams med pa'i las byas pas de'i phyir bdag la yun ring por gnod pa dang / phan pa med pa dang / sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur grang zhes yid mi bde zhing mi dga' bar gnas so //
translated: I have committed a heinous act, and so I will remain unhappy and displeased for a long time, because it will not be beneficial for me and will lead to my suffering.’

original: de'i phyir de la byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa 'dzin du 'jug go /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la byang chub sems dpa' sdom pa 'dzin du 'jug go /
translated: “Therefore, the bodhisattva makes that person take a vow.

original: nyes pa'ang 'chags su 'jug go /
analyzed: nyes pa'ang 'chags su 'jug go /

original: de la chos bstan pa zab mo zab mo'ang byed de /
analyzed: de la chos bstan pa zab mo zab mo'ang byed de /
translated: He or she teaches that person the profound Dharma.

original: de ste 'gyod pa mi gtong na /
analyzed: de ste 'gyod pa mi gtong na /
translated: If that person does not give up his or her remorse,

original: de'i phyir de la byang chub sems dpa' thog ma @47a *//
analyzed: de'i phyir de la byang chub sems dpa' thog ma @47a *//
translated: then the bodhisattva, in order to make that person give up his or her remorse,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Here is how.

original: rdzu 'phrul lam /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul lam /
translated: Either by means of supernormal powers

original: sems kun bsten pas yang dag par yid ches pa skyed do //
analyzed: sems kun bsten pas yang dag par yid ches pa skyed do //
translated: By relying on the mind, one will develop true confidence.

original: de nas sems can de yang dag par yid ches pa skyes nas byang chub sems dpa' de la dga' ba dang / mos pa dang / rangs pa rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas sems can de yang dag par yid ches pa skyes nas byang chub sems dpa' de la dga' ba dang / mos pa dang / rangs pa rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, when those beings have developed true confidence, they will find joy, interest, and delight in that bodhisattva.

original: de dag dga' ba dang / mos pa dang / rangs pa rnyed pas de chos bstan du rung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag dga' ba dang / mos pa dang / rangs pa rnyed pas de chos bstan du rung bar 'gyur /
translated: Having found joy, interest, and delight, they will become suitable vessels for the teachings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang mthun pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //🔽de nas byang chub sems dpa' des de'i mdun du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang mthun pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro // de nas byang chub sems dpa' des de'i mdun du 'di lta ste /
translated: They will be receptive to the bodhisattva’s teachings.🔽Then, that bodhisattva will manifest in their presence a father and mother,

original: pha mar sprul pa mngon par sprul te 'di skad zer ro //
analyzed: pha mar sprul pa mngon par sprul te 'di skad zer ro //
translated: and will say,

original: kye skyes bu /
analyzed: kye skyes bu /
translated: ‘Oh, people!

original: khyod ltos la 'gyod pa chod cig /
analyzed: khyod ltos la 'gyod pa chod cig /
translated: Look and be free of regret!

original: nga'ang khyod kyi grogs te /🔽las 'di lta bus su'ang shin tu sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: nga'ang khyod kyi grogs te / las 'di lta bus su'ang shin tu sems can dmyal bar 'gro ba'am /
translated: I am your friend.🔽There is no one who will go to the hells or🔽lose all their goals because of such actions.

original: don thams cad las nyams par 'gyur ba med do; ;las de ye shes kyis bsal du mi nus pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: don thams cad las nyams par 'gyur ba med do; ;las de ye shes kyis bsal du mi nus pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: Those actions cannot be removed by wisdom, either.’

original: zhes de skad smras nas pha ma srog dang phral lo //
analyzed: zhes de skad smras nas pha ma srog dang phral lo //
translated: Having said this, he took the life of his parents.

original: srog dang phral nas kyang rdzu 'phrul de ston to //
analyzed: srog dang phral nas kyang rdzu 'phrul de ston to //

original: de nas sems can de 'di snyam du sems te /

analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pas kyang pha ma srog dang phral na /

analyzed: bdag 'dra ba lta ci zhig smos snyam mo //

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'ang de'i tshe sems can de la ci nas kyang de'i las de sbrang ma'i 'dab ma 'dra bar 'gyur ba de lta de lta bu'i chos ston par byed do //
